items.message:
"This Flood Alert has been removed.  
The risk of flooding from recent thunderstorms and overnight rainfall has now reduced.  There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.  Further rainfall is forecast over the next few days.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  
"

The flood forecast has changed significantly. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.

The flood forecast has changed significantly. As a result, there is no longer a risk of flooding in the area.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.

items.description: River Kennet and its tributaries from Berwick Bassett down to Newbury

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Kennet, River Og, River Aldbourne, Froxfield Stream, River Dun, River Shalbourne

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. The forecast today, 25/07/23 is mostly dry, with the possibility of isolated light showers this afternoon. 
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.
No further rainfall is forecast.
River levels have been falling steadily at the Wigan; Wigan FAS gauge.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

items.description: River Douglas at Parbold, along the right bank of the river downstream of the Canal Bridge
items.message:
The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible.
No further rainfall is forecast.
River levels are now falling steadily, but still remain quite high in some locations and a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this warning if necessary.
There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.

items.description: Fouracres and The Crescent at Maghull
items.message:
The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible.
No property flooding is expected.
The forecast is dry for throughout the evening
River levels have began to fall, but still remain quite high in some locations and a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert/warning if necessary.
There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ouse, Burdyke, Holgate Beck, Blue Beck, River Foss, The Fleet

items.message: This flood alert has now been removed. We continue to monitor the situation and will reissue if necessary.
